EBF58207BB7642C0ABCC40FED382A876.description:
Prepare and interpret formal end-of-fiscal period financial statements.
 Prepare a balance sheet
 Prepare an income statement and calculate component percentages
 Prepare an owners' equity statement
 Journalize and post adjusting and closing entries
 Prepare a post-closing trial balance.

3C65AAF819EF4056913DF9D3608EE8B8.description:
Complete and analyze an accounting worksheet.
 Prepare a trial balance from the general ledger
 Analyze and calculate adjusting entries on the worksheet
 Extend and complete the worksheet to assess a net gain or net loss

447B489B0B334A498F43464BF5C83A35.description:
Analyze and complete payroll using appropriate accounting practices.
 Complete payroll time cards and payroll register
 Calculate gross earnings using regular and overtime hours
 Analyze and compute payroll deductions
 Determine net pay and prepare payroll checks

169CD3B3BA92460CA80FBC1C53097F80.description:
Post information from journals into general and subsidiary ledgers.
 Apply the procedure of posting separate amounts from a journal to a
general or subsidiary ledger.
 Post column totals from a journal to the general ledger.

5B6E17F82A4C47CC9B265BB45F5807CC.description:
Assess the accounting equation as a guide to journalize transactions.
 Use algebraic operations to work with the accounting equation
 Specify various journals such as general, multi-column, and special
 Apply the double-entry system of accounting to record business
transactions
 Total, prove, and rule journals
 Computer software may be utilized to complete transactions.

17E70006E3504CF6B91889B1D5429A79.description:
Examine, analyze, and categorize financial transactions.
 Classify assets, liabilities, and owners' equity
 Analyze usage of T accounts
 Analyze transactions into debit and credit parts
 Create and maintain proper file maintenance for all accounts

FA87CCA2E2384481838CA8F654421544.description: Demonstrate the basic principles and procedures of the accounting cycle.

9615A14F033546DDB8D2793AFD2D5A48.description:
Comprehend proper cash management techniques and prepare
necessary documents and transactions.
 Prepare banking documents along with a bank statement
reconciliation
 Establish and maintain a petty cash system
 Discuss ethical issues concerning business cash management

12BC6CB826A348308DC082BD6BAC80C3.description:
Compare and contrast various types of business ownership and
accounting principles that apply.
 Classify business ownership as sole proprietorship, partnership, or
corporation

DA505EDC78D644D581C585E03C26637F.description:
Identify career opportunities in the accounting profession.
 Identify career opportunities, skills, and competencies necessary
within the accounting profession
 Discuss ethical implications pertaining to the accounting profession

17A2BB275BC34B509D14A3F35BADFB05.description: Examine the role of accounting in business.
